title: NATIONAL | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
text: national adjective us /ˈnæʃ.ən.əl/ /ˈnæʃ.nəl/ uk /ˈnæʃ.ən.əl/ /ˈnæʃ.nəl/A2 a national holiday Britain has more than ten national newspapers. The company's national headquarters is in Rome. The children were wearing traditional national costume/dress. - The national anthems of the teams are played at the beginning of a big international soccer match. - A statue was erected to glorify the country's national heroes. - The idea behind the national lottery is to raise money for good causes. - Several passages from the book were printed in a national newspaper before it was published. - She was too young to vote in the national election.
